intro: Platycapnos spicata var. ochroleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered spirea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its slender, arching stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soil. It blooms in early spring, producing fragrant flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
